syllabus_info.syllabus_name: Cambridge International AS & A Level Chemistry 9701

learning_objectives.description: write formulas of ionic compounds from ionic charges and oxidation numbers (shown by a Roman numeral), including: (a) the prediction of ionic charge from the position of an element in the Periodic Table (b) recall of the names and formulas for the following ions: NO₃⁻, CO₃²⁻, SO₄²⁻, OH⁻, NH₄⁺, Zn²⁺, Ag⁺, HCO₃⁻, PO₄³⁻
(a) write and construct equations (which should be balanced), including ionic equations (which should not include spectator ions) (b) use appropriate state symbols in equations
define and use the terms empirical and molecular formula
understand and use the terms anhydrous, hydrated and water of crystallisation
calculate empirical and molecular formulas, using given data
